intro: Yervamora yervamora, commonly known as the red mountain apple, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright red fruits that resemble apples in appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are white or pink and bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The fruit is edible and has a tart flavor, often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
